program: Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering

courses.title: Calculus I
courses.prerequisite: MATH 2412 with a grade of 'C' or better; or passing the Precalculus Exemption Test administered by the Department of Mathematics.
courses.notes: An option for BSME admission requirements: C or better within 3 attempts

courses.title: Introduction to Mechanical Engineering
courses.notes: Can be taken as a Pre-ME major

courses.title: Engineering Graphics
courses.notes: Includes lecture and lab sections; Can be taken as a Pre-ME major

courses.title: Chemistry for Engineers
courses.prerequisite: MATH 1314, MATH 1414 or MATH 2412 with a grade of C or higher

courses.title: Chemistry for Engineers Lab
courses.prerequisite: Credit/registration in CHEM 1309.

courses.title: Introduction to Programming
courses.prerequisite: Concurrent enrollment or credit for MATH 1314 or higher level mathematics course.

courses.title: Learning Framework
courses.notes: As required, based on credit hours earned, TSI status, High School rank, major declaration.

courses.title: Communication (Core)
courses.prerequisite: For all 010 courses: Satisfactory scores on English portion of ACT test and TSI examination or ENGL 0301. For ENGL 1302, a grade of 'C' or better in ENGL 1301.
courses.notes: See General Education Core for more details. Option: ENGL 1301

courses.title: Calculus II
courses.prerequisite: MATH 2413 (or MATH 2487) with a grade of 'C' or better.

courses.title: Physics for Scientists and Engineers I
courses.prerequisite: MATH 2413.
courses.notes: 1 hour lab to count for 090 Core

courses.title: Engineering Materials
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in CHEM 1309 and CHEM 1109 or CHEM 1312 and CHEM 1112; a grade of 'C' or better or concurrent enrollment in MECE 2140.
courses.notes: Lecture and lab must be taken together. Cannot be taken more than two times without approval from the department. Can be taken as a Pre-ME major

courses.title: Engineering Materials Lab
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in CHEM 1309 and CHEM 1109 or CHEM 1312 and CHEM 1112; a grade of 'C' or better or concurrent enrollment in MECE 2340.
courses.notes: Lecture and lab must be taken together. Can be taken as a Pre-ME major

courses.title: Communication (Core)
courses.prerequisite: For all 010 courses: Satisfactory scores on English portion of ACT test and TSI examination or ENGL 0301. For ENGL 1302, a grade of 'C' or better in ENGL 1301.
courses.notes: See General Education Core for more details. Options: ENGL 1302 or ENGL 1305

courses.title: Engineering Statistics
courses.prerequisite: MATH 2413 and credit for or enrollment in MATH 2414.

courses.title: American History (Core)
courses.notes: See General Education Core for more details. Options: HIST 1301 or HIST 2327

courses.title: Manufacturing Processes
courses.prerequisite: MECE 2140 and 2340.

courses.title: Manufacturing Processes Lab
courses.prerequisite: Credit for [MECE 2140, MECE 2340, and MANE 3332] and credit for/registration in MANE 3364.

courses.title: Calculus III
courses.prerequisite: MATH 2414 (or MATH 2488) with a grade of 'C' or better.

courses.title: Physics for Scientists and Engineers II
courses.prerequisite: PHYS 2425 and MATH 2414.
courses.notes: 1 hour lab to count for 090 Core

courses.title: Mechanical Engineering Analysis
courses.prerequisite: A grade of C or better in CSCI 1380 and MATH 2414. Must be officially admitted to the Mechanical Engineering major.
courses.notes: Includes lecture and lab sections. Cannot be taken more than two times without approval from the department

courses.title: Statics
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in [MECE 1101 or CIVE 1221 or CIVE 1101] and PHYS 2425; a grade of 'C' or better or concurrent enrollment in MATH 2414. Must be officially admitted to the Mechanical Engineering major or Civil Engineering major.
courses.notes: Cannot be taken more than two times without approval from the department

courses.title: Mechanical Engineering Analysis II
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in (MECE 2350 and MECE 3449) or (MECE 3440 and MATH 2415) or (MECE 3449 and MECE 3440). Must be officially admitted to the Mechanical Engineering major.
courses.notes: Includes lecture and lab sections

courses.title: Dynamics
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in MECE 2301 and MATH 2414 (or MATH 2488). Must be officially admitted to the Mechanical Engineering major or Civil Engineering major.
courses.notes: Cannot be taken more than two times without approval from the department

courses.title: Thermodynamics I
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in CHEM 1309 or CHEM 1311, MATH 2414 and PHYS 2425. Must be officially admitted to the Mechanical Engineering major or minor.
courses.notes: Cannot be taken more than two times without approval from the department

courses.title: Electrical and Electronics Systems
courses.prerequisite: Grade of C or better in PHYS 2426.
courses.notes: Includes lecture and lab sections

courses.title: American History (Core)
courses.notes: See General Education Core for more details. Options: HIST 1302 or HIST 2328

courses.title: System Dynamics
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in MECE 2302 and MECE 3450.

courses.title: Fluid Mechanics
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in (MECE 3335 or MECE 2335) and MECE 3450.

courses.title: Mechanics of Solids
courses.prerequisite: A grade of C or better in MATH 2414, MECE 2340, and MECE 2301 or MANE 2403. Must be officially admitted to the Mechanical Engineering major or Manufacturing Engineering major.
courses.notes: Cannot be taken more than two times without approval from the department

courses.title: Kinematics & Dynamics of Machines
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in MECE 1221 and MECE 2302. Must be officially admitted to the Mechanical Engineering major.

courses.title: Social and Behavioral Sciences (Core)
courses.notes: Choose from: ECON 2301 Macroeconomics, PSYC 2301 General Psychology, or SOCI 1301 Introduction to Sociology

courses.title: Measurement & Instrumentation
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in (ELEE 2317 or EECE 2317) and MECE 3450 and (MANE 3332 or MANE 2332).

courses.title: Heat Transfer
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in MECE 3315.

courses.title: Thermal Fluids Laboratory
courses.prerequisite: A grade of C or better in MECE 3315 Fluid Mechanics and a grade of C or better or concurrent enrollment in MECE 3360 Heat Transfer.

courses.title: Machine Elements
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in MECE 2302, MECE 2340, and MECE 3321. Must be officially admitted to the Mechanical Engineering major.

courses.title: Prescribed Elective
courses.notes: MECE 33XX or MECE 43XX course from approved list -OR- one of the following, which requires prior approval from Department of Mechanical Engineering: (1) MECE 3100 for three terms, (2) MECE 3300 across two terms, (3) non-MECE advanced engineering, mathematics, or science course

courses.title: Creative Arts (Core)
courses.notes: See General Education Core for course options.

courses.title: Senior Design Project I
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in MECE 3304 and a grade of 'C' or better or concurrent enrollment in MECE 3315, MECE 3320, MECE 3360, MECE 3380, and MECE 4350.
courses.notes: Includes lecture and lab section

courses.title: Thermodynamics II
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in MECE 3335 or MECE 2335.

courses.title: Fundamentals of Engineering
courses.prerequisite: Junior standing in engineering and within two semesters of graduation.

courses.title: Prescribed Elective
courses.notes: MECE 33XX or MECE 43XX course from approved list

courses.title: Senior Design Project II
courses.prerequisite: A grade of 'C' or better in MECE 4361 and a grade of 'C' or better or concurrent enrollment in MECE 3315, MECE 3320, MECE 3360, MECE 3380, and MECE 4350.

courses.title: Prescribed Elective
courses.notes: MECE 33XX or MECE 43XX course from approved list
